snippet: I am very glad I have been in Scotland once more, and seen all those places and people; though it was smashing work at the time! snippet: 'After lectures,' Carlyle writes, -'and considerable reading for " Cromwell," talking about scheme of London library, struggling and concocting towards what proved " Chartism," and more of the like, we set out together for Scotland by Liverpool about July 2 or 3, for Scotsbrig both of us in the first place, then she to Templand as headquarters, and, after leaving here, then to return to Scotsbrig,  all which took effect, my remembrance of it now very indistinct.'
